Transcription for 19099

Well, there was a carpenter, Philip the Carpenter.
He used to, he was a clever old chap and a good tradesman.
And he used to make the coffins for the workers.
And the workers had to pay eight new a week towards the coffin ward.
And then if they died, you'd have the coffin for nothing.
That's through the company.
They'd stop eight new a week, coffin ward, they called it.
